snippet: The new “net price calculators” are supposed to tell you what college will really cost. But like all things in their infancy, there are growing pains.
abstract: Department of Education's new net price calculators, which colleges and universities are now obliged to put on their Web sites, get mixed reviews when tested by some currently enrolled students using their own financials; calculators estimate how much a student might actually have to pay and are meant to help potential students better understand what schools they can afford and how much debt they will incur.
lead_paragraph: The new “net price calculators” are supposed to tell you what college will really cost. But like all things in their infancy, there are growing pains.
